title: ğŸŒ HTML!
text:
What?

We can include one kind of HTML content in another kind of HTML content.
I term this â€œnestingâ€

title: ğŸŒ HTML!
ğŸŒ HTML!
ğŸŒ HTML!
text:
Why?

This sort of nesting is a natural way to arrange information.

Letters in words.
Words in sentences.
Sentences in paragraphs.
Paragraphs in essays.
Etc.

title: ğŸŒ HTML!
text:
âš ï¸ Caution

We can nest but not overlap.
Consider the example using bold and italics
Try this:



bad

<p>This is <em>very <strong>wrong</em>!</strong></p>


This is very wrong!


And this:



good

<p>This <em>is <strong>correct</strong>.</em></p>


This is correct.

title: ğŸŒ HTML!

To specify just the page content, we place it within a <body>.

title: ğŸŒ HTML!
text:

Most useful to look up how to do things.

E.g. center text with the <center> tag.

Working on projects together.
Creating websites or portfolios.

github.com/<account name>/<repository name>

â€œHTMLâ€ page â€œcontentâ€.

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
What?

Now: The first achievement when coding!
â€œHello, world!â€
Within GitHub codespaces, create a new file.

It must be called index.html
HTML for â€œhypertext markup languageâ€
The language of the internet!

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
How?

On the left side of the screen, ensure â€œExplorerâ€ is opened.
Two overlapping files 
A bar will pop out and at the top there will be a few icons.

Click the file with a + on it.
If missing, â€œmouseoverâ€ repository name!

Type index.html as the name and press enter.
A new file will open up, type â€œHello, world!â€

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
Why?

We want to be able to determine what appears on our webpage.
For now, it matters less what we change than that we can change the content.
Weâ€™ll learn more soon!

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
What?

We need changes made in codespaces to become changes in the repository.

You may wonder why this isnâ€™t automatic: Iâ€™m not sure!

To do so we will change from the â€œExplorerâ€ activity to the â€œSource Controlâ€ activity

Itâ€™s the technical term for â€œkeeping track of codeâ€

Lots of paperwork!

Click the 
Click  âœ“ Commit 

I get a box pop-up and say Always

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
ğŸš¨ Alert!

This pops up :



COMMIT_EDITMSG


# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting
# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.
#
# On branch main
# Your branch is up to date with 'origin/main'.
#
# Changes to be committed:
#   new file:   index.html
#







Caution


We must name our changes.

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
ğŸ¤ Resolve

Add any message to the first line:



COMMIT_EDITMSG

Hi it's me :)
### Please enter...


Click the âœ“ on the top right.
Click  Sync Changes 1 â†‘ 
Now go back to the repository page.

There should now be an index.html there!
You may need to refresh/reload.

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
Why?

We donâ€™t want just anyone or anything publish to a website we administer.

Spam, broken links, stale memes, etc.
Mostly GitHub doesnâ€™t want that and wonâ€™t leave it up to us!

This process requires every change to be intentional.

I would rather it be easier, but thatâ€™s okay!
It gets better every year!

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
What?

Letâ€™s take index.html and make it a webpage!
Weâ€™ll use â€œGitHub Pagesâ€

Not too hard to set upâ€¦
I use it a lot for fun ğŸ˜¬

Youâ€™ll be able to show anything you do to friends and family!

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
How?

Creating a GitHub Pages site
Or:

Back on the repository pageâ€¦ - <account name>.github.io/<repository name>
Weâ€™ll change repository settings.

On the top, click on  Settings
On the left, click on  Pages
In the middle, under branch, change â€œNoneâ€ to â€œMainâ€ via the drop-down menu.

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!

We get to examine what we did!

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
What?

Check our work.
Learn how to see where updates will show up.

A few minutes after â€œCommit+Syncâ€

Tell ourselves we did a good job!

text:

<account name>.github.io/<repository name>
Or:

Back to <> Code
Bottom right, under â€œDeploymentsâ€, click github-pages
There will be a link on this page under the heading github-pages

title: ğŸ“„ Webpages!
text:
Why?

Thereâ€™s many ways to publish online but this isâ€¦

Free.
Relatively quick (minutes, not hours).
Powerful enough for interactive, public webpages.

It also builds a lot of valuable skills!
